channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- CPG BIOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- CPG BIOS

item.title: CVE-2022-24418|2024-09-17T02:27:23.157Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2021-36285|2024-09-17T03:37:29.343Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious administrator could exploit this vulnerability to bypass excessive NVMe password attempt mitigations in order to carry out a brute force attack.

item.title: CVE-2022-31222|2024-09-17T03:54:45.001Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain a Missing Release of Resource after Effective Lifetime vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability by consuming excess memory in order to cause the application to crash.

item.title: CVE-2022-32489|2024-09-17T01:15:59.204Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-22566|2024-09-17T01:45:36.114Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Select Dell Client Commercial and Consumer platforms contain a pre-boot direct memory access (DMA) vulnerability. An authenticated attacker with physical access to the system may potentially exploit this vulnerability in order to execute arbitrary code on the device.

item.title: CVE-2022-32491|2024-09-17T01:37:11.565Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client BIOS contains a Buffer Overflow vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by manipulating an SMI to cause an arbitrary write during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-32485|2024-09-17T03:38:52.815Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2021-36284|2024-09-17T02:20:32.730Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious administrator could exploit this vulnerability to bypass excessive admin password attempt mitigations in order to carry out a brute force attack.

item.title: CVE-2022-24421|2024-09-17T03:37:56.003Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24420|2024-09-17T00:30:49.605Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2020-26186|2024-09-17T02:26:57.793Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 5675 BIOS versions prior to 1.4.1 contain a UEFI BIOS RuntimeServices overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the RuntimeServices structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2020-5378|2024-09-17T01:51:46.170Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell G7 17 7790 BIOS versions prior to 1.13.2 contain a UEFI BIOS Boot Services overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2022-31224|2024-09-17T02:01:23.598Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Improper Protection Against Voltage and Clock Glitches vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by triggering a fault condition in order to change the behavior of the system.

item.title: CVE-2021-21522|2024-09-17T03:23:12.635Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains a Credentials Management issue. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability to gain access to sensitive information on an NVMe storage by resetting the BIOS password on the system via the Manageability Interface.

item.title: CVE-2021-36323|2024-09-17T02:02:47.330Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2022-24415|2024-09-17T02:48:00.526Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution during SMM.

item.title: CVE-2022-31221|2024-09-17T00:11:09.228Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS versions contain an Information Exposure vulnerability. A local authenticated administrator user could potentially exploit this vulnerability in order access sensitive state information on the system.

item.title: CVE-2020-5348|2024-09-17T03:02:11.254Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Latitude 7202 Rugged Tablet BIOS versions prior to A28 contain a UAF vulnerability in EFI_BOOT_SERVICES in system management mode. A local unauthenticated attacker may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in system management mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-32859|2024-08-02T02:20:35.656Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-32860|2024-08-02T02:20:35.674Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-32855|2024-08-02T02:20:35.676Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information tampering.

item.title: CVE-2024-32858|2024-08-02T02:20:35.666Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information disclosure.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-22448|2024-08-01T22:43:34.907Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Out-of-Bounds Write vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to denial of service.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information disclosure.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user with admin privileges may potentially exploit this vulnerability to modify a UEFI variable, leading to denial of service and escalation of privileges

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information tampering.

item.description: Dell Client Platform contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by bypassing BIOS authorization to modify settings in the BIOS.

item.title: CVE-2023-32475|2024-06-07T17:00:46.144Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains a missing support for integrity check vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially bypass security mechanisms to run arbitrary code on the system.
